tasks.task: Conduct nutrient management practices on small livestock farms.
subtasks: Define a small farm (e.g., limited acreage, fewer animals, < $250,000 annual sales).
Store manure in a dry, level, impermeable location at least 100 feet from waterways.
Develop a plan for manure spreading and disposal (e.g., composting, mulching, central facilities).
Manage stormwater to prevent runoff into manure storages.
Fence animals away from streams and waterways.
Address neighbor concerns regarding manure management.
Utilize sacrifice areas and rotational grazing for better nutrient uptake.
Map the farm to plan spreading and storage locations.
Understand unique challenges small farms face in nutrient management.
